content.description: To the left of Big Chief, sit start on the slopes jug and move up through crimps, side pulls, pockets and a slope. Avoid the arete. Pseudo-eliminate.
Similar start to Hank Crank, but stay on the ledge underneath the large rail. Once you're past the tree, move across through a pocket series to the finish. Feels hard for a V1.
The original V2 traverse. Starts sit starting on the large rail and traverses the entire rail to the end of Big Chief.
content.location: Starting on the left side of the Big Chief Boulder. To the right of Layback.

content.description: Try your best to avoid a dab on this awkward and somewhat contrived but interesting boulder. Start matched on the horn feature with your body underneath the bulge and then move right to decent holds and maneuver to get on top of the slab.
content.location: It is slightly past the right arete of the Big Chief, look for the horn feature.

content.description: Crux is where the tree is at, so it's kinda sketch the first couple tries. Definitely one of the longest boulder problems in Austin
content.protection: Crux is at the tree, if you pop off the wall... you'll hit it with the back of your head. Also, next to the tree, left and right side, the roots are kinda gnarly. An awkward fall on those would easily twist an ankle. However, during the traverse you're never more than 2 feet off the ground, so you could just step down more than likely.
content.location: This is a longer version of the original V2 traverse that starts on the obvious rail slanting upwards from left to right. Instead of starting on the rail, start as far left as you can go. You should be sit-starting on the stairs. Once you traverse right and get to the point of the original start, you climb downwards to meet the original start and continue the traverse until you get to the arete. Climb the arete and you're finished. Climb down is obvious.

content.description: SDS on the far right-side of the Big Chief boulder  and climb the arete on large pockets.  The start is the crux of the route.
content.location: On the Big Chief Boulder, which is adjacent to the Walter Reed Boulder.  Go to the backside of the Walter Reed Boulder aka far left side of the Frontside boulder, and you will see the unusual long rails of the Big Chief Boulder.  The route starts on the far right side.

content.description: In the middle of the Big Chief Boulder, starting on the crimp rail below the large rail, traverse right through to a crimp and move up to a pocket and sloper till you meet up to the large rail. Finish by traversing to the end of Big Chief.
content.location: Middle of the Big Chief Boulder.

content.description: Completely shaded, the Big Chief boulder is located adjacent to the Walter Reed Boulder aka far left side of the Frontside Boulder.  It has a series of traverses on long rails and an arete climb with routes rated from V1-V2.  This boulder stands out as its rails distinctively slope upwards from left to right.
